name: Pull-Up
short explanation: Pull-ups are an effective compound exercise that targets the upper body, particularly the back muscles and biceps.
long explanation: Hang from a bar with hands slightly wider than shoulder width, pull yourself up until your chin is over the bar.
column8: Grip a pull-up bar with both hands placed about shoulder-width apart and palms facing away. Hang with your arms fully extended, keeping your legs slightly bent to avoid swinging. Pull yourself up by drawing the elbows down to the floor, raising your body until your chin is above the bar. Lower yourself slowly back to the starting position, maintaining control throughout the movement.

name: Tricep Dips
short description: Tricep dips target the triceps muscles at the back of the upper arms, enhancing arm strength and muscle definition.
short explanation: Using a bench or a chair, lower your body by bending your arms, then push back up to straighten them.
long explanation: Position yourself between two parallel bars or on the edge of a bench with your hands just outside of hip width. Lower your body by bending your elbows until they are at about a 90-degree angle. Push through your palms to lift your body back to the starting position, fully extending your arms.

name: Leg Raises
short description: Leg raises are primarily focused on strengthening the lower abdominals and hip flexors.
short explanation: Lie on your back with hands at your sides, lift your legs straight up towards the ceiling, then lower them without touching the floor.
long explanation: Lie flat on your back on a yoga mat, with your legs extended and your hands placed beneath your hips for support. Slowly lift your legs towards the ceiling, keeping them straight and together. Lower them back down just above the floor, keeping the core engaged throughout the movement.

name: Russian Twist
short description: The Russian twist is an exercise targeting the oblique muscles, enhancing core strength and rotational flexibility.
short explanation: Sit on the floor, lean back slightly, lift your feet, and twist your torso from side to side.
long explanation: Sit on the ground with your knees bent, feet lifted slightly off the ground. Lean back slightly to engage the core, and interlace your fingers or hold a weight. Rotate your torso to the right, bringing your hands beside your hip, then switch to the left side.

name: Box Jumps
short description: Box jumps are a dynamic exercise aimed at improving explosive leg power and overall athleticism.
short explanation: Stand in front of a step block, jump onto the block with both feet, then jump back down.
long explanation: Stand facing the step block with feet shoulder-width apart. Bend your knees and swing your arms to propel yourself up onto the block. Land softly on the block with both feet together, then step or jump back down to the starting position.
